DOC.brief_summary: This study examine influence dietary intake tryptophan response metformin . The investigator hypothesize dietary tryptophan alteration influence metformin response .
DOC.criteria: 1. healthy adult male nonpregnant female volunteer ( age 2040 ) 2. able willing give consent 1 . Age le 20 great 40 2 . Women pregnant , nursing , risk become pregnant 3 . Body mass index ( BMI ) less 20 great 28 4 . Changes 5 pound weight ( increase decrease ) month prior enrollment study 5 . Participation 300 minute exercise per week month prior enrollment study 6 . Known diabetes prediabetes ( base prior diagnosis , use medication low glucose ; fast blood glucose > 100mg/dL screen ) 7 . Untreated hypertension ( define systolic blood pressure > 140mmHg diastolic blood pressure > 90mmHg ) 8 . Current past mood disorder , include major depression , anxiety , bipolar disorder 9 . Conditions cause intestinal malabsorption , include celiac disease history intestinal gastric bypass surgery 10 . History liver disease and/or aspartate aminotransferase ( AST ) alanine aminotransferase ( ALT ) 3 time upper limit normal ( ULN ) 11 . Estimated glomerular filtration rate ( eGFR ) < 60 ml/min/1.73 m2 calculate Modification Diet Renal Disease equation 12 . Currently take intend take study duration medication know affect glycemic parameter , glucocorticoid , growth hormone , fluoroquinolones 13 . Use medication herbal vitamin supplement study 14 . Contraindications safe use metformin , include plan radiologic angiographic study require contrast within one week study completion 15 . Objection take metformin 16 . Participation interventional study study duration 17 . Use nicotinecontaining product , include inhale , chew , patch study . 18 . Use drug abuse . 19 . Restrictions prevent adherence standardize meal unwillingness adhere prespecified meal plan , include abstinence alcohol limitation caffeine intake one drink daily .
